\begin{document}

\title{Object Library}

\author{JFL}
\maketitle

\section{Lattice}

The lattice class encodes geometric information and provides geometric
transformations.

\begin{table}
\begin{minipage}{350pt}
\caption{Lattice: Data members}
\label{table1}
\addtolength\tabcolsep{2pt}
\begin{tabular}[c]{ccc}
  \hline \hline
long & \textbf{Nx\_,Ny\_,Nz\_} & number of points in each direction\\
long & \textbf{Ntot\_,Nout\_} & total number of points in real and in Fourier space*\\
double & \textbf{dx\_,dy\_,dz\_} & spacing in each direction\\
double & \textbf{L\_[3]} & dimension of total cell in each direction \\
\hline \hline
\end{tabular}
\end{minipage}
\end{table}

{*}In Fourier space, there are (about) half as many points as in real
space since each entry is complex and so has two degrees of freedom.
This is calculated as $\ N_{x}\times N_{y}\times\left(\left[\frac{N_{z}}{2}\right]+1\right)$
in accord with FFTW.

\begin{table}
\begin{minipage}{350pt}
\caption{Lattice: Get}
\label{table1}
\addtolength\tabcolsep{2pt}
\begin{tabular}[c]{ccc}
  \hline \hline
{double} & {\textbf{getDX()},...} & {accessors for dx\_,...}\\
{long} & {\textbf{Nx()},...} & {accessors for Nx\_,...}\\
{double} & {\textbf{Lx()},...} & {accessors for L\_[0],...}\\
{long} & {\textbf{Ntot()},\textbf{Nout()}} & {accessors for Ntot\_,Nout\_}\\
{long} & {\textbf{size()}} & {same as \textbf{Ntot()}}\\
{double} & {\textbf{dV}(),\textbf{getVolume}()} & dx\_dy\_dz\_{ and }L\_[0]L\_[1]L\_[2]\\
{double} & {\textbf{getX(}int pos\textbf{)},...} & $dx\_\times\left(pos-\frac{Nx\_-1}{2}\right)${,...} \\
\hline \hline
\end{tabular}
\end{minipage}
\end{table}

\begin{table}
\begin{minipage}{350pt}
\caption{Lattice: Get}
\label{table1}
\addtolength\tabcolsep{2pt}
\begin{tabular}[c]{ccc}
  \hline \hline
{\text{long } \textbf{pos(}int v[]\textbf{)},\textbf{pos(}int ix, int iy, int iz)} & {convert cartesian indices into serial index}\\
{void \textbf{cartesian(}long pos, int ix, int iy, int iz\textbf{)}} & {convert serial index to cartesian indices}\\
${\begin{array}{c}
{\text{long } \textbf{get\_PBC\_Pos(}\text{int }v[]\textbf{)}}\\
{\text{long } \textbf{get\_PBC\_Pos(}\text{int }ix, \text{int }iy, \text{int }iz\textbf{)}}\\
\end{array}} & {cartesian after applying PBCs }\\
{void \textbf{putIntoBox}(int \&ix, int \&iy, int\ \&iz)} & {apply PBC to give }$0\leq ix<N_{x}${,...}\\
{long \textbf{size()}} & {same as \textbf{Ntot()}}\\
{double \textbf{dV}(),\textbf{getVolume}()} & dx\_dy\_dz\_{ and }L\_[0]L\_[1]L\_[2]\\
{double \textbf{getX(}int pos\textbf{)},...} & $dx\_\times\left(pos-\frac{Nx\_-1}{2}\right)${,...} \\
\hline \hline
\end{tabular}
\end{minipage}
\end{table}
